summary: The Tribal Climate Health Assurance Act of 2025 aims to address the public health impacts of climate change on tribal communities. It mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services, through the CDC, to implement the Climate Ready Tribes Initiative. This initiative will focus on informing tribal governments, creating decision-support tools, leading climate change preparedness, mitigating health threats, and sharing resources. The bill authorizes $110 million annually for this purpose, starting in fiscal year 2026.
